1.     a        correct use of kinematic equation/equations    Substitution(s) must be correct.

                148.5 or 149 or 150 « m »                                                                                              2

                a      or 2.45 « m s–2 » 

(Question 1 continued)

   Question                                       Answers                                                 Notes                        Total
      c          ALTERNATIVE 1                                                       Award [2 max] for an answer of 160 k«W».
                 «work done to launch glider»  1370  149 «  204 kJ» 
                                          204  100
                 «work done by motor»              
                                             23

                                            204  100 1
                 «power input to motor»               80 or 80.4 or 81 k«W» 
                                               23     11




                 ALTERNATIVE 2
                 use of average speed 13.5 m s–1 
                                                                                                                                         3
                 «useful power output»  force  average speed «  1370  13.5 » 
                                                 100
                 power input  « 1370  13.5         » 80 or 80.4 or 81 k«W » 
                                                  23

                 ALTERNATIVE 3
                 work required from motor  KE  work done against friction
                 «  0.5  492  272  (160  148.5) »  204 « kJ » 


                                    work required from motor  100
                 «energy input»                                   
                                                  23
                                 883000
                 power input            80.3 k«W» 

   Question                             Answers                                                         Notes                                   Total
      d          direction of                                             Award [1 max] if forces do not touch the dot, but are otherwise OK.
                   motion
                                        lift force




                                                     drag

                                                                                                                                                 2
                                                     weight


                 drag correctly labelled and in correct direction 


                 weight correctly labelled and in correct direction AND
                 no other incorrect force shown 

2.     a        force/acceleration proportional to displacement «from             Do not award marks for stating the defining equation for SHM.
                equilibrium position» 
                                                                                  Award [1 max] for a 2 x with a and x defined.
                and directed towards equilibrium position/point                                                                                         2
                OR
                and directed in opposite direction to the displacement from
                equilibrium position/point 
       b    i                                     3.4
                frequency of buoy movement           or 0.097 «Hz»

                OR
                                        35
                time period of buoy        or 10.3 « s » or 10 « s » 

(Question 2 continued)

   Question                                     Answers                                                          Notes                                Total
      b     ii   peaks separated by gaps equal to width of each pulse «shape of peak      Judge by eye.
                 roughly as shown» 
                                                                                          Do not accept cos2 or sin2 graph
                 one cycle taking 10 s shown on graph                                    At least two peaks needed.
                                                                                          Do not allow square waves or asymmetrical shapes.

                 output power                                                             Allow ECF from (b)(i) value of period if calculated.
                                                                                                                                                        2


                            0
                                0                                              time / s




      c     i    PE of water is converted to KE of moving water/turbine to electrical
                 energy «in generator/turbine/dynamo» 
                                                                                                                                                        2
                 idea of pumped storage, ie: pump water back during night/when
                 energy cheap to buy/when energy not in demand/when there is a
                 surplus of energy 

(Question 2 continued)

   Question                                             Answers                                                            Notes                  Total
      c     ii    specific energy available  « gh  » 9.81 270 «  2650 J kg1 »
                  OR
                          1
                  mgh      mv 2
                          2
                                                                                                                                                    2
                  OR
                  v 2  2gh 

                  v  73 « ms1 »                                                                     Do not allow 72 as round from 72.8

      c     iii   total energy  « mgh  1.5  1010  9.81 270  » 4.0  1013 « J »                   Use of 3.971013 « J » gives 11 h.

                  OR                                                                                   For MP2 the unit must be present.
                                  1      1
                  total energy  « mv 2   1.5  1010  (answer (c)(ii))2  » 4.0  1013 « J »                                                     2
                                  2      2

                              4.0  1013
                  time  «                  » 11.1h or 4.0  104 s 
                             4  2.5  108

      c     iv    friction/resistive losses in pipe/fluid resistance/turbulence/turbine or generator   Must see “seat of friction” to award the
                  «bearings»                                                                           mark.
                  OR                                                                                   Do not allow “friction” bald.
                  sound energy losses from turbine/water in pipe 
                                                                                                                                                  2 max

                  thermal energy/heat losses in wires/components 


                  water requires kinetic energy to leave system so not all can be transferred 

(Question 3 continued)

   Question                                                Answers                                              Notes             Total
      c     ii   ALTERNATIVE 1
                 some thermal energy will be transferred to surroundings/along connecting wires/to
                 thermometer ü

                 estimate «of specific heat capacity by student» will be larger «than accepted value» ü


                 ALTERNATIVE 2
                 not all energy transferred as capacitor did not fully discharge ü
                                                                                                                                 2 max
                 so estimate «of specific heat capacity by student» will be larger «than accepted value» ü

     Question                                     Answers                                                          Notes                           Total
4.     a         «light» superposes/interferes 


                 pattern consists of «intensity» maxima and minima
                 OR                                                                                                                                  3

                 consisting of constructive and destructive «interference» 

                 voltage peaks correspond to interference maxima 
       b    i           D6.3  107  5.0                                               If no unit assume m.
                 «s                3

                        x       2.1 103
                 v «                  3
                                            » 8.4  102 « m s1 »                                                                                 2
                        t       25  10


       c    i                                                  0.13                      Award [1 max] for solution using 1.22 factor.
                 angular width of diffraction minimum              «  0.026 rad » 
                                                                5.0
                                                                                                                                                     2

                 slit width  «                » 2.4  105 « m » 
                                d     0.026
       c    ii   «beyond the first diffraction minimum» average voltage is               OWTTE
                 smaller 

                 «voltage minimum» spacing is «approximately» same                                                                                   2
                 OR
                 rate of variation of voltage is unchanged 

        d        «reflection at barrier» leads to two waves travelling in opposite directions ü
                 mention of formation of standing wave ü
                 maximum corresponds to antinode/maximum displacement «of air molecules»                                                     2 max
                 OR
                 complete cancellation at node position ü

(Question 5 continued)

   Question                                    Answers                                                                Notes                                      Total
      b     i    ALTERNATIVE 1

                 6 days is 5.18  105 s 


                 activity after 6 days is A0e 1.4 10
                                                         11
                                                                5.18  10 5
                                                                                A0      Award [1 max] if calculations/substitutions have numerical slips
                                                                                         but would lead to correct deduction.
                 OR                                                                      eg: failure to convert 6 days to seconds but correct substitution
                 A  0.9999927 A0 or 0.9999927 N0                                       into equation will give MP2.
                                                                                         Allow working in days, but for MP1 must see conversion of or
                 OR                                                                      half-life to day–1.
                                                                        A                                                                                          2
                 states that index of e is so small that                   is  1
                                                                        A0
                 OR
                  A  A0  10 15 « s 1 » 


                 ALTERNATIVE 2

                 shows half-life of the order of 1011 s or 5.0  1010 s 

                 converts this to year «1600 y» or days and states half-life
                 much longer than experiment compared to experiment 

(Question 5 continued)

   Question                                                 Answers                                                               Notes                     Total
      b     ii   ALTERNATIVE 1                                                                                       Must see correct substitution or
                                                                                                                     answer to 2+ sf for MP3
                 use of A  N0 


                 conversion to number of molecules  nNA  3.7  1020
                 OR
                 initial activity  5.2  109 « s–1 » 

                 number emitted  (6  24  3600)  1.4  1011  3.7  1020 or 2.7  1015 alpha particles 
                                                                                                                                                              3

                 ALTERNATIVE 2

                 use of N  N0 e   t 

                  N0  n  N A  3.7  10 20 

                 alpha particles emitted «  number of atoms disintegrated  N  N0  » N0 (1  e   6243600 )

                 or 2.7  1015 alpha particles 

(Question 5 continued)

   Question                                      Answers                                                       Notes                          Total
      c     i    alpha particles highly ionizing                                     Do not allow reference to tunnelling.
                 OR
                 alpha particles have a low penetration power
                 OR                                                                                                                             1
                 thin glass increases probability of alpha crossing glass
                 OR
                 decreases probability of alpha striking atom/nucleus/molecule 
      c     ii   conversion of temperature to 291 K                                 Allow ECF for 2.7 1015 from (b)(ii).

                                                291
                  p  4.5  109  8.31 «              »
                                             1.3  105

                 OR
                                                          291                                                                                   3
                  p  2.7  1015  1.38  10 23  «               » 
                                                       1.3  10 5


                  0.83 or 0.84 « Pa » 

(Question 5 continued)

   Question                                         Answers                                    Notes                 Total
      d          electron/atom drops from high energy state/level to low state 
                 energy levels are discrete 
                                                                                                                       3
                 wavelength/frequency of photon is related to energy change or quotes E  hf
                        hc
                 or E     and is therefore also discrete 
                         
      e          peer review guarantees the validity of the work
                 OR
                                                                                                                       1
                 means that readers have confidence in the validity of work 
                                                                            – 17 –                 M17/4/PHYSI/HP2/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


     Question                                         Answers                              Notes                        Total
6.     a         when an electric field is applied to any material «using a cell etc» it
                 acts to accelerate any free electrons 
                 electrons are the charge carriers «in copper»                                                           3
                 metals/copper have many free electrons whereas insulators have
                 few/no free electrons/charge carriers 
       b    i             1.7  108  35  103
                 area                          «  9.3  106 m2 » 
                                   64
                                                                                                                          2
                                          6
                               9.3 10
                 radius  «                     » 0.00172 m 
                                      
       b    ii               Ppeak
                 Ipeak «            »  730 « A » 
                             Vpeak
                                                                                                                          1

   Question                                  Answers                                                     Notes                                    Total
      b     iii                                         64                 Allow [3] for a solution where the resistance per unit metre is
                  resistance of cable identified as «      » 2          calculated using resistivity and answer to (a) (resistance per unit

                                                                           length of cable 5.7 10–5 m )

                          seen in solution                                                                                                         3
                   35000                                                                      V2

(Question 6 continued)

   Question                                  Answers                                                       Notes                         Total
      d          wires/cable attract whenever current is in same direction        Award [1 max] if response suggests that there is
                                                                                   repulsion between cables at any stage in cycle.

                 charge flow/current direction in both wires is always same «but
                 reverses every half cycle»                                                                                            2 max

                 force varies from 0 to maximum 

                 force is a maximum twice in each cycle 

      e     i    higher voltage gives lower current 
                                                                                                                                           2
                 «energy losses depend on current» hence thermal/heating/power
                 losses reduced 

      e     ii   laminated core                                                   Do not allow “wires are laminated”.                     1

7.     a    i                     hc 1.99  1025                                         If no unit assume m.
                 wavelength  «               19
                                                    » 5.7  107 « m »                                                                     1
                                  E   3.5  10
       a    ii   «potential» energy is required to leave surface                         Do not allow reference to “binding energy”.
                                                                                          Ignore statements of conservation of energy.



                                                                                                                                             2


                 all/most energy given to potential «so none left for kinetic energy» 



       b         energy surplus  1.7  1019 J                                          Award [1 max] if surplus of 5.2 10–19J used
                                                                                          (answer: 1.1 106 m s–1)
                                                                                                                                             2
                           2  1.7  10 19
                 v max                      6.1 105 « m s1 » 
                             9.1 10 31

       c    i    «same intensity of radiation so same total energy delivered per square   Reason is required
                                                                                                                                             1
                 metre per second»
                 light has higher photon energy so fewer photons incident per second 


       c    ii   1:1 correspondence between photon and electron                          Allow ECF from (c)(i)
                 so fewer electrons per second                                           Allow ECF from MP2 to MP3.
                                                                                                                                             3

                 current smaller 

     Question                                         Answers                                                       Notes                         Total
8.     a         potential is defined to be zero at infinity ü


                 so a positive amount of work needs to be supplied for a mass to reach
                 infinity ü                                                                                                                         2




       b    i             GM
                 VS        so r VS «   GM »  constant because G and M are constants                                                          1
                           r
       b    ii   GM  1.33  1020 « J m kg1 »                                                  Award [1 max] unless answer is to 2 sf.

                                            1.33 1020  6.0 1024                               Ignore addition of Sun radius to radius of
                 GPE at Earth orbit «                   11
                                                                   »  «  » 5.3  1033 « J»    Earth orbit.
                                                  1.5  10                                                                                          2

(Question 8 continued)

   Question                                                   Answers                                                     Notes                Total
      b     iii   ALTERNATIVE 1                                                                             Various approaches possible.

                                                                       GMm
                  work leading to statement that kinetic energy           , AND kinetic energy evaluated
                                                                        2r
                  to be «  » 2.7  1033 « J » 

                  energy «  PE  KE  answer to (b)(ii)  2.7  1033 »  « » 2.7 1033 « J » 
                                                                                                                                                 2

                  ALTERNATIVE 2

                                                          1
                  statement that kinetic energy is        gravitational potential energy in orbit 
                                                          2
                                  answer to (b)(ii)
                  so energy «                        »  « » 2.7 1033 « J » 
                                         2

      b     iv    «KE will initially decrease so» total energy decreases
                  OR
                  «KE will initially decrease so» total energy becomes more negative 
                                                                                                                                               2 max
                  Earth moves closer to Sun 
                  new orbit with greater speed «but lower total energy» 
                  changes ellipticity of orbit 

(Question 8 continued)

   Question                                  Answers                                                        Notes                            Total
      c          centripetal force is required                                   Award [1 max] for statement that there is a “centripetal
                                                                                  force of gravity” without further qualification.
                                                                                                                                              2
                 and is provided by gravitational force between Earth and Sun 
